optionalFeatureTypes.SF:F:GWM: Skill Feature: Feat: Great Weapon Master

variantrule.name: Skill Trees
entries: The rules surrounding Skill Trees and Skill Features:

entries.name: Skill Features and Points
entries: {@b Skill Features.} Skill Features are additional optional features that you can obtain through feats or being part of one of the classes (Artificer, Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Ranger, or Rogue) that you get them at certain levels. These features act a lot like feats, as in providing extra abilities your character can use. Whenever you use one of these abilities, you must expend the required amount of skill points.

{@b Skill Points.} Skill Points (SP) are a representation of how many times you can use a skill feature. You have a number of Skill Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus + the Amount of Skill Features you have. You regain all skill points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and a number equal to half your Proficiency bonus (rounded up) when you finish a {@variantrule  Short Rest|XPHB}

entries.name: Skill Features from Feats
entries: {@b Feat Trees.} Certain Feats have been altered or added to be in a Skill Tree. This skill tree is always seperated into 4 Tiers, each tier getting its own abilities. The first Tier only has abilities with skill costs, if it allows you to cast spells. If you can only select Tier 4 with a feat, you may also pick another available Tier from another Feat. You only gain the ability bonus from the first feat.

{@b Origin Feat.} When you are able to choose an {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o}, you may instead choose the Skill Tree variant of it (if it has one). When you choose it in this way, you get the first two Tiers of that feat. When you get the {@feat Magic Initiate|XPHB} feat, you can instead choose between the following Orgin Feats: {@feat Divine Favour|WoSkTr}, {@feat Druidic|WoSkTr}, {@feat Learned Caster|WoSkTr}, {@feat Musical Caster|WoSkTr}, {@feat Sorcerous Blood|WoSkTr}, and if you use the {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa} {@feat Spiritual Boon|WoSpHa}.

{@b General Feat.} When you are able to choose a feat, you can instead choose a skill tree variant of a {@filter General|feats|category=g} or {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o}. You always get the first two available Tiers of that feat. You cannot choose Tiers 3 or 4 with a feat, before reaching level 8.

{@b Chosen from Class.} You get the first available tier of a {@filter Feat Tree|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:F}. A Tier 1 and 2 feature can only be chosen after reaching level 3, Tier 3 after reaching level 5, and Tier 4 after reaching level 7.

entries.name: Skill Features from Classes
entries: {@b Common Rules.} When you reach a certain level in a martial or half caster, you can choose a skill feat from a skill tree of their class or a Feat Tree, provided they meet the prerequisites.

{@b Martials.} A martial class ({@filter Barbarian|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:B}, {@filter Fighter|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:Fi}, {@filter Monk|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:M}, and {@filter Rogue|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:Ro}) may choose one skill feat when they reach level 3, and once again each odd level and level 20 gained in that class.

{@b Half Casters.} A half caster ({@filter Artificer|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:A}, {@filter Paladin|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:P}, and {@filter Ranger|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF:Ra}) may choose one skill feat when they reach level 3, and once again every 3rd level and level 20 gained in that class.

{@b Multiclassed.} When you have multiclassed into two classes that get skill feats, you may also pick from the Skill Tree of the other class. You must still meet the level requirements of that class to pick the feature.

entries.name: Skill Features from Starter Package
entries: {@b Level 3 Freebie.} When any PC reaches level 3, you gain 1 Skill Feature listed in the {@feat Starter Package|WoSkTr}. You do not get an additional SP from this freebie.

{@b Chosen from Feat.} When chosen as a feat, you can choose 2 Skill Features listed in the {@feat Starter Package|WoSkTr}, as well as increase 1 ability of your choice by 1 (max 20). You also gain 2 SP.
{@b Chosen from Class.} When chosen from a class, you can choose 1 Skill Feature listed in the {@feat Starter Package|WoSkTr}. You also gain 1 SP.

condition.name: Bleeding
entries: While bleeding you lose {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns. Unless otherwise specified, this {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} loss is equal to your half your level (rounded down) or its CR (min of 1) for NPCs.

condition.name: Crippled
entries: While your are Crippled, you experience the following effects:

items.name: Reactions Affected
entries: You cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

items.name: Actions Affected
entries: You can only take an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, not both.

items.name: No Movement
entries: Your speed becomes 0 and cannot be increased.

condition.name: Slowed
entries: While you are Slowed, you experience the following effects:

items.name: Limited Movement
entries: You must spend 1 extra foot of movement for every foot you move using your Speed.

items.name: Reactions Affected
entries: You cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

items.name: Dexterity Saves Affected
entries: You have Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Skill Points
entries: A representation of Skill Points that can be expended using your Skill Features. You have an amount equal to your proficiency bonus + the number of Skill Features. You regain all when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest} or an amount equal to half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded up), when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Impersonation
entries: While you're disguised as a real or fictional person, you have Advantage on Charisma (Deception or Performance) checks to convince others that you are that person.

entries.name: Charismatic
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you fail a Charisma (deception, performance, or, persuasion) check you may add {@dice 1d4} to the roll (no action required).

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic the sounds of other creatures, including speech. A creature that hears the mimicry must succeed on a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine the effect is faked (DC 8 plus your Charisma modifier and Proficiency Bonus).

entries.name: Re-enactment
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Your ability to act as another, allows you to re-enact a scene with ease. During the next minute, you and all creatures, within 30 feet, of your choice get a {@dice 1d6} bonus to the first Intelligence and Wisdom check made to figure out what happened.

entries.name: Truly Innocent
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

Your ability to act as another person allows you to get out of difficult situations. When you or an ally, you can see within 30 feet, is found to be lying or doing something you shouldn't, use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a Charisma (performance) check. On a success you and your allies can get away scot-free.

entries.name: Initiative Swap
entries: Immediately after you roll initiative, you can swap your initiative with the initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You cannot make this swap when you or the ally has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Alert Reflexes
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you are attacked while {@condition Prone|XPHB} and/or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB|Asleep}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to stand up immediately, negating any advantage the attacker would have had.

entries.name: Initiative Proficiency
entries: When you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.

entries.name: Alert Search
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When attempting to take the {@action Search|XPHB} action to spot a hidden creature or object, while in combat, you can make the ability check as a free action.

entries.name: Make Others Aware
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When rolling initiative you can give all allies, within 30ft, that can see or hear you, your proficiency bonus to add to their initiative roll.

entries.name: Hop Up
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.

entries.name: Jumping
entries: You can make a running Long or High Jump after moving only 5 feet.

entries.name: Physically Trained
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When failing a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check or save, you may add 1d4 to the result (no action required). (Uses 1 SP).

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

entries.name: Athletic Speed
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As an action you can increase your speed by 10 feet for 1 hour. You can only get this benefit once in that hour.

entries.name: Ready Muscles
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When making a Dexterity (acrobatics) or Strength (athletics) check, you won't roll lower than a 10 by spending a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} preparing yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Attacker
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Whenever you miss with an {@action Attack|XPHB}, you may add your proficiency bonus to the result, potentially turning a miss into a hit (no action required). Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Street Magic
entries: You gain the cantrip {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} you can only use to replicate stage magic effects. You may conceal verbal and somatic components with this spell. Use your original spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries.name: Ace up your Sleeve
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} you can imbue one card with a spell you know. The spell must have a casting time of 1 Action or less, be of a level you can cast, and have no material cost. The card stays imbued until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. It takes a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cast this spell using the card, expending the spell.

entries.name: Card Magic
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you may draw a card for free. You gain an effect depending on the suit:

{@b Spades:} You gain a magical shield, which protects you from damage and harms your attacker. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1). Any creature that deals damage to you, while you have these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} will take psychic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1).
{@b Clubs:} You deal extra psychic damage to the target or another creature within 30 feet of target. The amount is equal to 2 times your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1).
{@b Diamonds:} You or a creature within 30 feet, of your choice, gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points}. The amount is equal to 2 times your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1).
{@b Hearts:} You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The amount is equal to 2 times your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1).
{@b Jokers:} You choose two suits to replicate the effect from.
When you draw the card with the imbued spell, you may also instantly cast it.

entries.name: Dice Instead of Cards
entries: If you lack a set of playing cards, you can instead roll dice to determine the card. Use the following method to determine the card:
To determine the suit and card type roll a {@dice 1d20} on the table below. If you already rolled the resulting card today (joker can be rolled twice), roll again.

entries.caption: Card Type
rows: Spades Ace (1) to 10. Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the number.
Clubs Ace (1) to 10. Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the number.
Diamonds (1) Ace to 10. Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the number.
Hearts Ace (1) to 10. Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the number.
Spades Jack (1-3), Queen (4-6), King (7-9), or Joker (10). Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the card.
Clubs Jack (1-3), Queen (4-6), King (7-9), or Joker (10). Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the card.
Diamonds Jack (1-3), Queen (4-6), King (7-9), or Joker (10). Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the card.
Hearts Jack (1-3), Queen (4-6), King (7-9), or Joker (10). Roll {@dice 1d10} to determine the card.

entries.name: Aces up your Sleeve
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP per spell level}

Instead of imbuing 1 card, with the {@optfeature Cartomancer (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Ace up your Sleeve} feature, you may also imbue an additional copy on 3 other cards of your choice, each being from another suit. These copies can only be cast when drawn using the {@optfeature Cartomancer (Tier 2)|WoSkTr| Card Magic} feature. You can create more of these copies, but it costs an additional 1 SP per spell level for each 3 copies.

entries.name: Queen up your Sleeve
entries: You may also imbue a second, different, spell onto a card, when using your {@optfeature Cartomancer (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Ace up your Sleeve} feature. You must use the same rules for this spell as described in that feature.

entries.name: Power of the Cards
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

After drawing a card, using your {@optfeature Cartomancer (Tier 2)|WoSkTr| Card Magic} feature, you may increase the effect amount by the number on the card. Drawing a Jack, King, and Queen counts as 10. An Ace and Joker counts as 11.

optionalfeature.name: Charismatic
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Whenever you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB}, using Charisma, you may add your proficiency bonus to the roll total. You may add it after your make the roll, but before knowing the result (no action required). Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Charge Attack
entries: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before hitting it with a melee attack roll as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, choose one of the following effects: gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the attack's damage roll, or push the target up to 10 feet away if it is no more than one size larger than you. You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Improved Charge
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you make a {@optfeature Charger (Tier 2)|WoSkTr|Charge Attack} feature, you can choose to instead use both of the effects, instead of just one.

entries.name: Improved Dash
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, your Speed increases by 10 feet for that action.

entries.name: Strike and Evade
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After moving past a creature, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an attack against them. You don't trigger an {@variantrule Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from that creature.

entries.name: Barreling Charge
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When moving in a straight line, all creatures, of your choice, you move within 5 feet of must succeed a Strength saving throw, against 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier + proficiency bonus, or take your weapon's damage equal to 3 times your Strength or Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1) and be pushed 5 feet back.

entries.name: Chef's Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}.

entries.name: Chef's Food
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, using {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}, you can make food for up to an amount of creatures equal to 4 + your prof. At the end of the {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, if they spend at least 1 hit die, they regain an additional {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Chef's Treat
entries: You can spend 1 hour making an amount of treats equal to your Proficiency bonus. These treats last for 8 hours. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a creature can eat the treat to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Chef's Kiss
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After finishing making treats, you can also add your level to the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} gained when eating the treat.

entries.name: Chef's Nutrition
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

As part of making the {@optfeature Chef (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|meal} during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can give all who eat it one 1d6 they can use for one {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} until the next {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Well Fed
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When preparing a meal as part of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, using cook's utensils, you can give an amount of creatures resting with you, equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus, a cook's reroll, which functions like {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}. The cook's reroll lasts until they finish another {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with three different Artisan's Tools of your choice from the Fast Crafting table.

entries.name: Discount
entries: Whenever you buy a nonmagical item, you receive a 20 percent discount on it.

entries.caption: Fast Crafting
rows: {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|XPHB}, {@item Map or Scroll Case|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB}
{@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Bucket|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB}, {@item Iron Pot|XPHB}

entries.name: Flimsy Craft
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Spending 1 minute, you can quickly craft an item you have Artisan's Tools for on the Fast Crafting Table. This item falls apart after 10 minutes.

entries.name: Fast Craft
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can craft one piece of gear from the Fast Crafting table, provided you have the Artisan's Tools associated with that item and have proficiency with those tools. The item lasts until you finish another {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point the item falls apart.

entries.name: Distracting Craft
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As a bonus action, while holding Artisan's Tools, you can construct something to distract your opponent. Your next attack is made with advantage, after which the object it destroyed.

entries.name: Distracting Craft
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

As part of a weapon attack, while holding your Artisan's Tools, you can attempt to destroy your opponent's weapon, shield, or magical focus. Make a Dexterity check with your tool, contested by an Dexterity (acrobatics) check. If you succeed the creature gets a permanent -1 penalty to their AC from the shield or attack rolls made with that weapon or focus. If the penalty is equal to the AC bonus of the shield or -5 for the focus and weapon, they are destroyed. You can only use this feature once a turn.

entries.name: Ignore Loading
entries: You ignore the Loading property of the Hand Crossbow, Heavy Crossbow, and Light Crossbow (all called crossbows elsewhere in this feat). If you're holding one of them, you can load a piece of ammunition into it even if you lack a free hand.

entries.name: Dual Wielding
entries: When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the extra attack if that attack is with a crossbow that has the Light property and you aren't already adding that modifier to the damage.

entries.name: Dual Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

On your turn you may shoot two bolts at once as part of the attack action with a crossbow, each at the same or a different target (no action required). You use the same attack roll for both. You roll damage for each bolt. Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with crossbows.

entries.name: Hidden Sight Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When a creature is within 5 feet of you and between you and your target, you can use the blocked line of sight to your advantage. You may give yourself {@dice 1d6} bonus to your attack roll with a crossbow (no action required).

entries.name: Precise Bolt
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, after a hit with a crossbow, you may make your shot even more precise. Your bolt gets two additional damage die for that shot.

entries.name: Push
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space if the target is no more than one size larger than you.

entries.name: Oppressive Push
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you push a using your {@optfeature Crusher (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Push} feature, you may move 5 feet towards it and make another attack.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature have Advantage until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Tripping Attack
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage, you may also knock them {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This can be applied together with the {@optfeature Crusher (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Push} feature.

entries.name: Debilitating Attack
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage, you may also cripple their movement, causing them to be {@condition Slowed|WoSkTr} until the end of your next turn. This can be applied together with the {@optfeature Crusher (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Push} and {@optfeature Crusher (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Tripping Attack} features.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Blocker
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Whenever you take damage, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage taken equal to your proficiency bonus + half your level (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Damager
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Whenever you deal damage with a weapon attack or a spell, you may add your proficiency bonus to one damage roll (no action required). Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 1 spell of the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|level=1|class=Cleric}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Divine Spark
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

As an action you can target one creature within 30 feet of you. That creature heals for or takes necrotic/radiant damage equal to 2d8 + your spellcasting modifier. When dealing damage, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn one level 2 and one level 3 spell of the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Cleric}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Improved Divine Spark
entries: {@i Cost: 1-3 SP}

When using your {@optfeature Divine Favour (Tier 2)|WoSkTr|Divine Spark} feature you may spend 1 SP to add two additional die or target one additional creature within range. For each time you do this, spend 1 SP, to a maximum of 3 SP. You may target 3 creatures and roll two additional dice, if you spend 3 SP.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=Druid}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 1 spell of the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=1|class=Druid}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Wild Companion
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

As a magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} you can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell, without using magical components. The familiar is considered a Fey, which vanishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn two level 1 spells of the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=1|class=Druid}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn one level 2 and one level 3 spell of the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Druid}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Wild Shape
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You know three Wild Shape forms of CR 1/2 or lower, without a flying speed. As a bonus action you can transform into one of the known forms, using the Druid {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2|XPHB} Rules. You can replace one known form for another after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn another level 2 and level 3 spell of the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Druid}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Parry
entries: If you are only holding one one-handed weapon, and a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your proficiency bonus to your AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. You gain this bonus to AC against melee attacks, until the start of your turn.

entries.name: Distracting Strike
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

After hitting, while only holding one one-handed weapon, you may give them a {@dice -1d4} penalty on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} the target uses before the start of your next turn. Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: From the Left
entries: When you miss with an attack, when you are only holding one one-handed weapon, you may use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a second attack against the same target.

entries.name: Revenge Attack
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

If you are only holding one one-handed weapon, and a creature hits you with an attack, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately strike back. You can use this reaction together with the {@optfeature Duelist (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Parry} feature.

entries.name: Quick Strikes
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP for each additional attack}

After making an attack with an one-handed weapon, while holding only that weapon, you quickly attack another creature within 5 feet of the first target. Make another attack for each target you want to attack.

entries.name: Keen Eye
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (perception) and Intelligence (investigation) checks to spot hidden objects.

entries.name: Travel Awareness
entries: Travelling at fast pace doesn't impose a -5 penalty to perception checks.

entries.name: Dungeon Proficiency
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you fail an ability check related to a dungeon or cave, you can add {@dice 1d4} to the roll.

entries.name: Trap Resistant
items: You have advantage on saving throws against traps.
You have resistance against damage from traps.

entries.name: Close Quarters Fighting
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When fighting a creature in an enclosed area no wider than 15 feet, you can add {@dice 1d6} to your attack roll. Only once per turn.

entries.name: Master Dungeoneer
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

By spending 10 minutes examining the dungeon around you, you can learn exactly how it is laid out. After that you will have advantage on any ability checks and saving throws made in relation to the dungeon. This lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Speedy Recovery
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one of your Hit Die, roll the die and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll.

entries.name: Reactive Healing
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you have taken damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll one hit die. You must be conscious to be able to use this reaction.

entries.name: Death Defiance
entries: You have advantage on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Condition Healer
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you need to attempt a saving throw against being {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, Diseased, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, you may spend one hit die to heal by that amount and add it to the saving throw result. You must add it before making the roll.

entries.name: Death Prevention
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to spend a Hit Die. Roll it and regain Hit Points equal to the roll, instead of being reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Elemental Weakening
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. Your damage ignores Resistance to damage of the chosen type.

entries.name: Elemental Immunity Breaker
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you attempt to deal damage to a creature that is immune to your chosen damage type, you can use your bonus action to treat it as resistance until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Energy Master
entries: You treat any 1 on any damage of your chosen type as a 2.

entries.name: Improved Energy
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP per Damage Die Rerolled}
When you deal damage using your chosen damage type, you may reroll a damage die and choose the higher result.

entries.name: Elemental Weakness
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

When you attempt to deal damage to a creature that is not immune or resistant to your chosen damage type (after applying the {@optfeature Elemental Adept (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Elemental Weakening} feature), you can use a bonus action to make it vulnerable until the start  of your next turn.

entries.name: Fey-Magic
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} and one 1st level spell of the {@filter Divination or Enchantment|spells|level=1|school=E;D} school of magic, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and school.

entries.name: Fey Trickery
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
You understand the tricks of the fey better. After you fail an Dexterity (sleight of hand) or Charisma (deception) check, you may add 1d4 to the result (no action required).

entries.name: Stronger Fey-Magic
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn {@spell Summon Fey|XPHB} and one 2nd level spell of the {@filter Divination or Enchantment|spells|level=2|school=E;D} school of magic, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier. You may ignore material components when casting {@spell Summon Fey|XPHB} using SP.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and school.

entries.name: Fey Charm
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

As an action, you may use your fey charm on a humanoid or beast within 30ft of you. They must succeed a Wisdom saving throw, against your spell save DC. On a failure they are {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you for 1 hour. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, it sees you as a trusted friend that needs to be protected. They can reattempt the saving throw if you or your allies do something harmful to it. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Punch and Grab
entries: When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use both the Damage and the {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} option. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

entries.name: Attack Advantage
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you.

entries.name: Retraining Grapple
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As a bonus action you may restrain the creature you have {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, which lasts until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Fast Wrestler
entries: You are not {@condition Slowed|WoSkTr} when grappling a creature of your size or smaller.

entries.name: Crushing Grapple
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you have a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, you can use your bonus action to crush them. They take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Colossus Grappler
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You may attempt to grapple a creature that is two or more sizes larger than you, as part of the unarmed attack action or another method that allows you to grapple a creature. That creature does not gain advantage on a roll to resist being {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. You are not {@condition Slowed|WoSkTr} when grappling this creature.

entries.name: Heavy Weapon Mastery
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon that has the heavy property, you can deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Forceful Blow
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you hit with a heavy weapon, you can take the Shove action (no action required).

entries.name: Hew
entries: When you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 HP with a melee attack, you may make another melee attack, with the same weapon, as a bonus action.

entries.name: Heavy Damage Master
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When using a heavy weapon, you can use your bonus action to turn its damage die into a {@dice 1d12} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Wide Swing
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP for each additional creature}
After making an attack with a melee weapon with the heavy property, you can continue your swing to another creature within your weapon's range. Make another attack for each creature.

entries.name: Ignore Loading
entries: You ignore the loading property of firearms.

entries.name: Graze
entries: When you miss with your firearm, the target still takes damage equal to your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Quick Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As a bonus action you may make an additional shot using your firearm, provided you already attacked with a firearm on that turn.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5ft of an enemy no longer imposes disadvantage on your firearm attack rolls.

entries.name: Revenge Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you are hit by an attack roll, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to shoot with your firearm at them. On a hit the target has disadvantage on their next attack roll, until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Precise Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
As a bonus action, after a hit with a firearm, you may make your shot even more precise. Your bullet gets two additional damage die for that shot (no action required).

entries.name: Battle Medic
entries: When you use a healer's kit to use the Utilize action to tend to a creature within 5 feet, that creature can expend one of its hit die and roll it. It regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Field Medic
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As an Utilize action using a charge of a healer's kit, you may heal another (non undead/construct) creature, within 5 feet, for {@dice 2d6} + Wisdom modifier + their level.

entries.name: Healing Rerolls
entries: Whenever you roll a die to determine the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you restore with a spell or with this feat's benefits, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Condition Cures
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

As an Utilize action using a charge of a healer's kit, you may cure an ailment of another (non undead/construct) creature within 5 feet. When that creature is {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, Diseased, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Paralysed|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned}, make a Wisdom (medicine) check against its save DC. On a success, the creature is cured of the condition.

entries.name: Healing Spores
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

As an Utilize action you can send out healing spores, using a charge of a healer's kit. All allies within 30 feet of you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom mod + their level.

optionalfeature.name: Healthy
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you may add a bonus to the total {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} regained (no action required). The bonus is equal to your proficiency bonus + half your level (rounded down) Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Bolstering Performance
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can give an inspiring performance: a speech, song, or dance. When you do so, choose up to six allies (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of yourself who witness the performance. The chosen creatures each gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your character level plus the modifier of the ability you increased with this feat.

entries.name: Encouranging Words
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

As a bonus action you may give one companion within 30 feet {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level plus the modifier of the ability you increased with this feat. The creature must be able to understand you.

entries.name: Empowering Words
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As a bonus action you may give one creature that can hear and understand you, within 30 feet, {@dice 1d6} to add to their next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Lead by Example
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When you successfully hit with an attack, succeed a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give up to 6 creatures within 30 feet advantage on their next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Intelligent
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Whenever you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB}, using Intelligence, you may add your proficiency bonus to the roll total. You may add it after your make the roll, but before knowing the result (no action required). Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Sense of Direction
entries: You always know which way is north.

entries.name: Sense of Time
entries: You always know the number of hours until the next sunset or sunrise.

entries.name: Lore Knowledge
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain Expertise in it.

entries.name: Knowledgable Persistence
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After failing an Intelligence ability check, you may add {@dice 1d4} to the roll (no action required).

entries.name: Quick Study
entries: You can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Uhm Actually
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you see a creature, within 30 feet, fail an Intelligence ability check to recall knowledge, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction} make one and add {@dice 1d6} to the result.

entries.name: Legendary Knowledge
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

Instead of making an Intelligence ability check to recall knowledge about a legendary figure, item, or the like, you can instead spend 10 minutes to gain information akin to {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB}.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 1 spell of the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|level=1|class=Wizard}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Copy Ritual
entries: You can learn {@filter Ritual Spells|spells|components & miscellaneous=ritual} by copying a written form of it into your spell book. This takes 2 hours and 50 GP for each level of the spell.

entries.name: Cast Ritual
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
You can always cast ritual spells copied into your spell book as a Ritual. You must spend 1 SP each time you cast a spell in this manner.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn one level 2 and one level 3 spell of the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Wizard}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Magical Knowledge
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When you finish a Long Rest, you can exchange any of your level 1, 2, and 3 spells, gained in this feat, for another of the same list and level. You also gain expertise in one Intelligence skill of your choice, until you finish another Long Rest.

entries.name: Concentration Breaker
entries: When you damage a creature that is Concentrating, it has Disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain Concentration.

entries.name: Concentration Breaking Strike
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you deal damage, with a weapon attack, to a spellcaster that is Concentrating, you may add an additional damage dice (no action required).

entries.name: Guarded Mind
entries: If you fail an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Spell Dodger
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you take damage from a spell, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10} + your level.

entries.name: Spell Resistant
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When you are forced to make a saving throw against a spell, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give them advantage on the save and resistance to damage from that spell.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|level=0|class=Warlock}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Eldritch Invocation
entries: You learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|feature type=EI}, provided you are a warlock that meets the prerequisite of it.

entries.name: Invocation Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen invocation for another of the, provided you are a warlock that meets the prerequisite of it.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn two level 1 spell of the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|level=1|class=Warlock}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Upcasting
entries: You may spend one additional SP, for each level of the spell after first you want to cast the chosen spell at. The highest level you can cast it at is 1 at {@filter 1st|spells|level=1|class=Warlock}, 2 from {@filter 3rd|spells|level=2|class=Warlock} (3 SP), 3 from {@filter 5th|spells|level=3|class=Warlock} (4 SP), 4 from {@filter 7th|spells|level=4|class=Warlock} (5 SP), and 5 from {@filter 9th-level|spells|level=5|class=Warlock} (6 SP).

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of this list and a level you can cast using this feature. You must always spend the required amount of Skill Points to cast a higher level spell.

entries.name: Steps of the Fey Patron
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn Misty Step, which you can cast using your SP or your spell slots. When you cast it using your SP, you force all creatures, of your choice, within 5 feet of where you teleported from to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure they have disadvantage on all attack rolls made against any target other than you. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Divine Light of the Celestial Patron
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
As a bonus action you may heal another creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. That creature regains 2d6 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Dark Blessing of the Fiendish Patron
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level + your spellcasting modifier (no action required). When another creature reduces an enemy, within 10 feet of you, to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you also gain this benefit. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Psychic Spells of the Great Old One
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can change its damage type to psychic (no action required).

entries.name: Mind Magic of the Great Old One
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you cast a spell from the Enchantment or Illusion school of magic, you can ignore the verbal and somatic components of that spell (no action required).

entries.name: Improved Eldritch Invocation
entries: You learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|feature type=EI}, provided you are a you meet the prerequisite of it. You can use your total level instead of Warlock level for those prerequisites.

entries.name: Invocation Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen invocation for another of the, provided you meet the prerequisite of it. You can use your total level instead of Warlock level for those prerequisites.

entries.name: Magical Secrets
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 4 spell of the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|level=4|class=Warlock}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 4 SP. You can cast this spell using SP, only once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of this list and a level you can cast using this feature. The spell level you can choose from increases to 5 at {@filter 9th|spells|level=5|class=Warlock}, 6 at {@filter 11th|spells|level=6|class=Warlock}, and 7 {@filter 13th-level|spells|level=7|class=Warlock}.

entries.name: Mounted Strike
entries: While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any unmounted creature within 5 feet of your mount that is at least one size smaller than the mount.

entries.name: Veer
entries: While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you can force an attack that hits your mount to hit you instead if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Run Over
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP per Creature}

While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat} and moving, you can attempt to move through other creature's spaces (no action required). Each creature, one size smaller than the mount, must succeed a Dexterity saving throw, against 8 + your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus, or be knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}, allowing you to pass through its space unhindered. If the creature succeeds you cannot move through its space this round.

entries.name: Leap Aside
entries: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails. For your mount to gain this benefit, you must be riding it, and neither of you can have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: War Mount
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you can also command the mount to take the attack action, instead of only the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Dodge} actions. The mount may use your proficiency bonus for this attack.

entries.name: Strike and Run Over
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

After hitting with an attack while {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you may move up to half your speed to the target and attempt to knock them {@condition Prone|XPHB} (No action required). They must succeed a Strength Saving throw, against 8 + your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus, or be knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB} and take {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning damage. Only half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Instrument Proficiency
entries: You become proficient in one Musical Instrument of your choice. You can use your chosen Musical Instrument as a magical focus.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Bard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Bard}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 1 spell of the {@filter Bard spell list|spells|level=1|class=Bard}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Musical Inspiration
entries: As a bonus action you can give another creature within 30 feet, that can hear you, musical inspiration. Once within the next hour, that creature can add a {@dice 1d4} to the result of failed {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, potentially turning it into a success, expending the inspiration.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn one level 2 and one level 3 spell of the {@filter Bard spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Bard}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Soothing Music
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

During a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} you can play a soothing melody, which allows a number of creatures, equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus, to regain an additional {@dice 1d4} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for each {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} they spend.

entries.name: Lip Reader
entries: If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips.

entries.name: Keen Observer
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, or {@skill Perception|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency with the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain Expertise in it.

entries.name: Keen Eye
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

You have an easier time figuring out another creature's intentions and finding stuff. When making an Intelligence (investigation) or Wisdom (insight/perception) check, you may add {@dice 1d4} to your check total. The dice can be added before or after making the roll (no action required).

entries.name: Quick Search
entries: You can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.

entries.name: Utilise Knowledge
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you know someone's intentions or that they lied or spotted a hidden object or creature, you can add a {@dice 1d6} to any failed Charisma ability check related to your knowledge, potentially turning a failure into a success (no action required).

entries.name: Keep an Eye on You
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

After spotting a hidden object or creature, you can use your reaction to keep an eye on it. For the next hour it cannot benefit from the Hidden or {@condition Invisible|XPHB} conditions against you, provided they remain within 1 mile of you.

entries.name: I Know You
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

After rolling a successful Wisdom (insight) check to determine a creature's intentions or whether they were lying, you can use your reaction to always know. For the next hour you know the creature's intentions or whether they are lying.

optionalfeature.name: Physical
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

Whenever you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB}, using Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution, you may add your proficiency bonus to the roll total. You may add it after your make the roll, but before knowing the result (no action required). Can only be used once per turn.

entries.name: Puncture
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Clean Through
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After hitting with a weapon attack that deals Piercing damage, you may deal extra damage equal one weapon die (no action required). This extra damage cannot benefit from a Critical Hit.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra Piercing damage the target takes.

entries.name: Two for One
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

If another creature is within 5 feet of the original target hit by an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can deal damage to them. To determine this damage roll the weapon's damage die, and use its result (no action required).

entries.name: Punctured Artery
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

After you hit with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can use your bonus action to make the target {@condition Bleeding|WoSkTr|Bleed}. While bleeding the target loses {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, equal to half your level (rounded down) at the start of their turn, until they or another creature makess a Wisdom (medicine) check, against 8 + your Strength or Dexterity Mod + your proficiency bonus, to stop it. Choose Strength or Dexterity for the check DC, when you get this feature.

entries.name: Poisoner Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the Poisoner's Kit.

entries.name: Quick Apply
entries: You may apply any poison to a weapon or three piece of ammunition as a bonus action.

entries.name: Poison DC
entries: All poisons use 8 + your Dexterity or Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus as its save DC, instead of the normally listed DC. Choose Dexterity or Intelligence when you choose this feature.

entries.name: Brew Poison
entries: After finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use your Poisoner's Kit to create doses of simple poison, equal to proficiency bonus, that last until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Each dose, once applied to a weapon or ammunition lasts for 1 minute and will deal an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage if the creature fails a Constitution save. Only half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Natural Poison
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP per Dose}

Using materials found nearby and your Poisoner's Kit, you can spend 1 hour brewing a number of poison doses, up to the an amount equal to the ability modifier chosen in Tier 1 (minimum of 1), spending 1 SP per dose. These poison doses last until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Each dose, once applied to a weapon or ammunition lasts for 1 minute or after hitting with it. After hitting with a coated weapon or piece of ammunition it will deal an additional {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn, if the creature fails a Constitution save. Only half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Master Poisoner
entries: You ignore poison resistance when dealing damage using poison.

entries.name: Special Poisons
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP per Dose}

Using your {@optfeature Poisoner (Tier 2)|WoSkTr|Natural Poisoner}, you may now instead create a poison that applies one of the following conditions, instead of the short {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} effect: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Bleeding|WoSkTr}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}. The effect lasts for 1 minute, ending early if the creature succeeds the saving throw at the end of their turn.

entries.name: Natural Poison Bombs
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP per Bomb Crafted}

Using materials found nearby, you may spend an hour making natural poison bombs, up to an amount equal to equal to the ability modifier chosen in Tier 1 (minimum of 1). As an attack action, you may throw a bomb up to 30 feet. Every creature in a 15 feet radius must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn. Only half damage on a success.

entries.name: Special Poison Bombs
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP per Bomb Crafted}

Using materials found nearby, you may spend an hour making special poison bombs, up to an amount equal to equal to the ability modifier chosen in Tier 1 (minimum of 1). As an attack action, you may throw a bomb up to 30 feet. Every creature in a 15 feet radius must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become affected by one of the conditions listed in the {@optfeature Poisoner (Tier 3)|WoSkTr|Special Poisons} feature (choose condition when crafting) for 1 minute. They may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns. Only half damage on a success

entries.name: Pole Strike
entries: Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and attack with a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach}, you can use a Bonus Action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. The weapon deals Bludgeoning damage, and the weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}.

entries.name: Pole Reach
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

On your turn you can increase the range of your {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach} by an additional 5 feet for the current attack (no action required).

entries.name: Reactive Strike
entries: While you're holding a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach}, you can take a Reaction to make one melee attack against a creature that enters the reach you have with that weapon.

entries.name: Tripping Swipe
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

After you hit with a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach}, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw, against 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failure they are knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}. Choose Strength or Dexterity to use as save modifier when you get this feature.

entries.name: Improved Reactive Strike
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

After you hit with your {@optfeature Polearm Master (Tier 2)|WoSkTr|Reactive Strike} feature, that creature takes additional damage and have their speed is 0 feet, until the end of the current turn (no action required). The extra damage is equal to one of the weapon dice.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: You've trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon's damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

entries.name: Reckless Attacks
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
As a bonus action you can give yourself advantage on all weapon attacks until the start of your next turn. All attack made against you are also at advantage until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Bloody Strikes
entries: Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can add 1d4 to the damage total (no action required).

entries.name: Bonus Attack
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Once on your turn, immediately after hitting with a weapon attack, you may make another one as a bonus action.

entries.name: Murderous Hits
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When you score a Critical Hit with a weapon attack, you may add two weapon damage dice to the critical damage (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Saver
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Whenever you fail a saving throw, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your proficiency bonus to the result, potentially turning a fail into a success.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} against that creature.

entries.name: Punish
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you hit with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, you may deal extra damage, equal to your weapon die.

entries.name: Halt
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, the creature's Speed becomes 0 for the rest of the current turn.

entries.name: Respond
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When a creature moves into your attack range or attacks you, you may use your Reaction to make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} against them.

entries.name: Restrain
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
When you hit with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} you may make the target become {@condition Restrained|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} and one 1st level spell of the {@filter Illusion or Necromancy|spells|level=1|school=I;N} school of magic, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and school.

entries.name: Shadow Eyes
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Use a magic action to gain 60ft of magical {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} for 1 hour.

entries.name: Stronger Shadow Magic
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn {@spell Summon Undead|XPHB} and one 2nd level spell of the {@filter Illusion or Necromancy|spells|level=1|school=I;N} school of magic, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier. You may ignore material components when casting {@spell Summon Undead|XPHB} using SP.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and school.

entries.name: Utilise Darkness
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When in darkness, you may spend a bonus action to give yourself advantage on a Dexterity (stealth) or Wisdom (perception) check. You may then take then also {@action Hide|XPHB} and {@action Search|XPHB} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bypass Cover
entries: Your ranged attacks with weapons ignore Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover.

entries.name: Long Shots
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Aim
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you make an attack roll with a ranged weapon, you can give yourself a penalty on the attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus. On a hit the target takes additional damage equal to your level (no action required).

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Pinning Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

After you hit with a ranged weapon attack, you can immediately force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw, againt 8 + your Dexterity modifier + proficiency bonus, or become {@condition Grappled|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Precise Shot
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
As a bonus action, after a hit, you may make your ranged weapon attack even more precise. You get two additional damage die for that attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries: If you attack a creature within 5 feet of you as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit with a Melee weapon, you can immediately bash the target with your Shield if it's equipped, forcing the target to make a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Strength modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, you either push the target 5 feet from you or cause it to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition (your choice). You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Protect
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your Reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack, provided you are holding a shield.

entries.name: Interpose
entries: If you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can take a Reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and are holding a Shield.

entries.name: Fortify
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
If you have not moved this turn, you can make your speed 0, but add your proficiency bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn, provided you are holding a shield.

entries.name: Retaliatory Bash
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

If you are hit by an attack from a creature within 5 feet, you can use your Reaction to use {@optfeature Shield Master (Tier 1)|WoSkTr|Shield Bash} feature on them. When doing so, you deal an additional {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage. Only half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Fog of War
entries: You exploit the distractions of battle, gaining Advantage on any Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check you make as part of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action during combat.

entries.name: Sniper
entries: If you make an attack roll while hidden and the roll misses, making the attack roll doesn't reveal your location.

entries.name: Professional Sniper
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you hit with an attack roll, you can choose to remain hidden and thus not revealing your location.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Sneak Attack
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Once per turn, after hitting with an attack while Hidden, you add an additional 2d6 damage to the damage with that attack.

entries.name: Unseen
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}
While Hidden, you may use a bonus action, to be considered Invisible until the start of your next turn. The effect ends early if you end your turn in plain sight.

entries.name: Hamstring
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can reduce the Speed of that creature by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Painful Slash
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can deal additional damage. The damage is equal to one weapon die for that attack.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Slashing damage to a creature, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Slash and Slash Again
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
After you hit with a weapon attack that deals slashing damage, you can immediately use your bonus action to make another weapon attack that deals slashing damage.

entries.name: Bleeding Slash
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

When you hit with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can use your bonus action to make the target bleed (nor action required). While bleeding the target loses HP, equal to half your level (rounded down) at the start of their turn, until they or another creature uses a Wisdom (medicine) check, against your 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus, to stop it. Choose Strength or Dexterity for the check DC, when you get this feature.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 1 spell of the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|level=1|class=Sorcerer}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Metamagic
entries: {@i Cost: minimum 1 SP}
You learn one {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM} feature. You can use this metamagic feature by spending a number of SP, equal to the listed sorcery points.

entries.name: Exchange Metamagic
entries: After each level up you may exchange your metamagic feature for another.

entries.name: Level 2 & 3 Spells
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

You learn one level 2 and one level 3 spell of the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|level=2;3|class=Sorcerer}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 3 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace one chosen spell for another of the same level and list.

entries.name: Magical Knowledge
entries: {@i Cost: Minimum of 1 SP}
Choose another {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM} feature, which follows the same rules as described in {@optfeature Sorcerous Blood (Tier 2)|WoSkTr}.

entries.name: Unleash Energy
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}

As a bonus action you can unleash your magic for 1 minute, during which your gain the following benefits: Your Sorcerous Blood Spells spell DC increases by 1 and you have advantage on attack rolls with those spells.

entries.name: Speed Increase
entries: Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Dash over Difficult Terrain
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action on your turn, Difficult Terrain doesn't cost you extra movement for the rest of that turn.

entries.name: Careful Speed
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
You can take both the {@action Dash|XPHB} and {@action Disengage|XPHB} together as a bonus action.

entries.name: Agile Movement
entries: Opportunity Attacks have Disadvantage against you.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

When you are {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, you can use a bonus action to make a Strength (athletics) or Dexterity (acrobatics) check, against the effect's DC, to escape. This check is made with advantage.

entries.name: Extreme Speed
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
As an action, you can add 30 feet to your movement speed for 1 hour. You ignore the effects of Difficult Terrain for that hour. You can only get the benefits of this feature once in that hour.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two Cantrips of the {@filter Spiritualist spell list|spells|level=0|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Eldritch Invocation
entries: You learn one {@filter Medium Intuition|optionalfeatures|feature type=MeIn}, provided you are a warlock that meets the prerequisite of it. Use +2 as Séance bonus, if the feature requires one.

entries.name: Invocation Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen invocation for another of the, provided you are a warlock that meets the prerequisite of it.

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn two level 1 spells of the {@filter Spiritualist spell list|spells|level=1|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 2 SP. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Upcasting
entries: You may spend one additional SP, for each level of the spell after first you want to cast the chosen spell at. The highest level you can cast it at is 1 at {@filter 1st|spells|level=1|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}, 2 from {@filter 3rd|spells|level=2|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} (3 SP), 3 from {@filter 5th|spells|level=3|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} (4 SP), 4 from {@filter 7th|spells|level=4|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} (5 SP), and 5 from {@filter 9th-level|spells|level=5|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} (6 SP).

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of this list and a level you can cast using this feature. You must always spend the required amount of Skill Points to cast a higher level spell.

entries.name: Biokinetic Séance
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
Using a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

entries.name: Minor Possession
entries: After you cast a cantrip or spell of 1st level or higher, you can boost or hinder one of your targets. The target gets a bonus or penalty (your choice) to their {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} results. Te bonus/penalty is equal to 2, and it lasts until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Cryokinetic Séance
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
Using a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

entries.name: Frigid Aura
entries: All enemy creatures, who start their turn within 10 feet of you will take {@damage 2d4} Cold damage.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Electrokinetic Séance
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
Using a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

entries.name: Electrifying Reflexes
entries: You may take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Charged Body
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws and saving throws against being {@condition Paralyzed} or {@condition Stunned}.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Pyrokinetic Séance
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
Using a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fire Touch
entries: Once on your turn, you may add 2d6 fire damage when you deal damage with a weapon attack or cantrip.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Telekinetic Séance
entries: {@i Cost: 3 SP}
Using a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute, or until you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

entries.name: Poltergeist Activity
entries: Two tiny sized objects will start levitating around you. As a bonus action you may make a ranged spell attack against a target within 30 feet, for each object. On a hit the target takes {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier bludgeoning damage. Use the same spellcasting modifier you chose in tier 1.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to force damage.

entries.name: Improved Medium Intuition
entries: You learn one {@filter Medium Intuition|optionalfeatures|feature type=MeIn}, provided you are a you meet the prerequisite of it. You can use your total level instead of Spiritualist level for those prerequisites. Use +2 as Séance bonus, if the feature requires one.

entries.name: Intuition Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen invocation for another of the, provided you meet the prerequisite of it. You can use your total level instead of Spiritualist level for those prerequisites.

entries.name: Spiritual Insight
entries: {@i Cost: 2 SP}

You learn one level 4 spell of the {@filter Spiritualist spell list|spells|level=4|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}, which you can cast using spell slots or by spending 4 SP. You can cast this spell using SP, only once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Use the same ability, as chosen in tier 1, as your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: After each level up you can replace your chosen spell for another of this list and a level you can cast using this feature. The spell level you can choose from increases to 5 at {@filter 9th|spells|level=5|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}, 6 at {@filter 11th|spells|level=6|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}, and 7 {@filter 13th-level|spells|level=7|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}.

entries.name: Survival Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill, if you lack it. If you already have proficiency you gain expertise.

entries.name: Forager
entries: You always are able to forage or hunt for food and drink for a party of 4 + your proficiency bonus, while in nature. You are unable to use this feature if you are in inhospitable environment.

entries.name: Traveller
entries: The travel speed is doubled for the party.

entries.name: Survivalist Intuition
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}
When you fail a Wisdom (survival) or Intelligence (nature) check, you can add 1d4 to the result, potentially turning a failure into a success.

entries.name: Tracker
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (survival and perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks when tracking a creature or finding a plant.

entries.name: Trapper
entries: {@i Cost: 1 SP}

At the start of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} you can trap your resting area. When a non allied creature enters the area, it must succeed a Dexterity saving throw, against 8 + your Dexterity or Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus, or become {@condition Restrained|XPHB} in the trap. It can use its action to make a Strength (athletics) check to try to escape. Success or Fail, you and your allies will be aware the trap is triggered. The traps remain active, until you finish the rest. Choose Dexterity or Wisdom for the save modifier when you get this feature.
